dimensions.name: Task Response
dimensions.description: Task Response evaluates how well a response addresses the prompt, presents a clear position, and develops ideas with relevant support.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-1: The response is completely unrelated to the task or does not attempt the task in any way, showing no understanding or engagement with the prompt.
Score 2-3: The response barely addresses the task, lacks a clear position, and presents few ideas that are largely undeveloped or irrelevant.
Score 4-5: The response partially addresses the task with some relevant ideas, but the position may be unclear, and the development of main ideas is limited or includes irrelevant details.
Score 6-7: The response addresses all parts of the task with a clear position, presenting relevant main ideas that are generally supported, though some ideas may be inadequately developed or overly generalized.
Score 8-9: The response fully addresses all parts of the task, presents a well-developed position with relevant, extended, and well-supported ideas, demonstrating a strong understanding of the prompt.

dimensions.name: Coherence and Cohesion
dimensions.description: Coherence and cohesion refer to the clarity and logical flow of ideas in a text, as well as the effective use of linguistic devices to connect those ideas.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-1: Characteristics: Fails to communicate any message or has very little control over organizational features, resulting in a lack of clarity and coherence.
Score 2-3: Characteristics: Ideas are poorly organized, with minimal use of cohesive devices that do not indicate logical relationships between ideas, leading to confusion.
Score 4-5: Characteristics: Presents information with some organization but lacks overall progression; may misuse cohesive devices and struggle with paragraphing, resulting in repetitive or unclear writing.
Score 6-7: Characteristics: Arranges information coherently with a clear progression; uses a range of cohesive devices effectively, though there may be occasional faults in cohesion or paragraphing.
Score 8-9: Characteristics: Skillfully organizes information and ideas with logical sequencing; manages cohesion seamlessly and uses paragraphing effectively to enhance clarity and flow.

dimensions.name: Lexical Resource
dimensions.description: Lexical Resource refers to the range and accuracy of vocabulary used in communication, assessing the ability to convey precise meanings and the control of lexical features.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: Extremely limited vocabulary with little to no control over word formation and spelling, severely hindering communication and understanding.
Score 3-4: Very basic vocabulary used repetitively or inappropriately, with noticeable errors in word formation and spelling that may cause strain for the reader.
Score 5-6: Limited but adequate vocabulary that meets the task requirements; some attempts at using less common words may lead to inaccuracies, but communication remains mostly clear.
Score 7-8: A sufficient range of vocabulary that allows for flexibility and precision; includes less common lexical items with occasional inaccuracies, but overall demonstrates good control and fluency.
Score 9-10: A wide and sophisticated range of vocabulary used fluently and flexibly, with very few minor errors, showcasing exceptional control over lexical features and precise meanings.

dimensions.name: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
dimensions.description: Grammatical Range and Accuracy refers to the variety and correctness of grammatical structures used in writing or speaking, reflecting the speaker's or writer's proficiency in the language.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: 
  Limited or no ability to use sentence forms; communication is severely hindered, often relying on memorized phrases.
Score 3-4: 
  Attempts to use sentence structures but frequent grammatical errors distort meaning; very limited range of structures with predominant inaccuracies.
Score 5-6: 
  Mixes simple and complex sentences; some grammatical errors are present but do not significantly impede communication; limited range of structures with occasional attempts at complexity.
Score 7-8: 
  Demonstrates a variety of complex structures with good control; most sentences are error-free, with only occasional minor errors or inaccuracies.
Score 9-10: 
  Exhibits a wide range of structures with full flexibility and accuracy; rare minor errors occur only as slips, showcasing a high level of grammatical proficiency.

dimensions.name: Task Response
dimensions.description: Task Response evaluates how well a response addresses the prompt, presents a clear position, and develops ideas with relevant support.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-1: The response is completely unrelated to the task or does not attempt the task in any way, showing no understanding or engagement with the prompt.
Score 2-3: The response barely addresses the task, lacks a clear position, and presents few ideas that are largely undeveloped or irrelevant.
Score 4-5: The response partially addresses the task with some main ideas, but development is limited and may include irrelevant details or unclear conclusions.
Score 6-7: The response addresses all parts of the task with a clear position, presenting relevant main ideas that are extended and supported, though some ideas may be over-generalized or inadequately developed.
Score 8-9: The response fully addresses all parts of the task, presenting a well-developed position with relevant, extended, and well-supported ideas throughout.

dimensions.name: Coherence and Cohesion
dimensions.description: Coherence and cohesion refer to the logical organization of ideas and the effective use of cohesive devices to create a clear and connected flow of information in writing.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score Range: 0-2
- Characteristics: Very little to no control over organizational features; ideas are poorly connected or completely disjointed, making it difficult to understand the message.
Score Range: 3-4
- Characteristics: Ideas are not logically organized, with minimal use of cohesive devices; any connections made are unclear or repetitive, leading to confusion in understanding.
Score Range: 5-6
- Characteristics: Some organization of information is present, but overall progression may be lacking; cohesive devices are used, though they may be mechanical or inconsistent, and paragraphing may not always be logical.
Score Range: 7-8
- Characteristics: Information and ideas are logically organized with clear progression; a range of cohesive devices is used appropriately, and paragraphing is managed well, contributing to the clarity of the writing.
Score Range: 9-10
- Characteristics: Exceptional organization and flow of ideas; cohesion is seamless and unobtrusive, with skillful paragraphing that enhances the overall clarity and effectiveness of the writing.

dimensions.name: Lexical Resource
dimensions.description: Lexical Resource refers to the range and accuracy of vocabulary used in communication, assessing the ability to convey precise meanings and the control of lexical features.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: Extremely limited vocabulary with little to no control over word formation and spelling, severely hindering communication and understanding.
Score 3-4: Very basic vocabulary used repetitively or inappropriately, with significant errors in word formation and spelling that may cause strain for the reader.
Score 5-6: Limited but adequate vocabulary for the task, with some attempts at using less common words; errors in spelling and word formation are present but do not impede overall communication.
Score 7-8: Sufficient to wide range of vocabulary used flexibly and fluently, with occasional inaccuracies in word choice or collocation; rare errors in spelling or word formation may occur.
Score 9-10: Extensive and sophisticated vocabulary used with natural control, conveying precise meanings with very few minor errors, demonstrating a high level of lexical proficiency.

dimensions.name: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
dimensions.description: Grammatical Range and Accuracy refers to the variety and correctness of sentence structures used in writing or speaking, reflecting the speaker's or writer's command of grammar.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: 
  - Characterized by an inability to use sentence forms effectively, with reliance on memorized phrases or complete lack of grammatical structure.
Score 3-4: 
  - Demonstrates attempts at sentence formation, but frequent grammatical and punctuation errors distort meaning, with limited use of complex structures.
Score 5-6: 
  - Shows a mix of simple and complex sentences, with some grammatical errors that may occasionally hinder communication, but generally maintains a basic level of accuracy.
Score 7-8: 
  - Utilizes a variety of complex structures with good control over grammar and punctuation, producing mostly error-free sentences with only occasional minor mistakes.
Score 9-10: 
  - Exhibits a wide range of structures with full flexibility and accuracy, making rare minor errors that do not detract from overall communication.

Score 6-7: The response adequately addresses all parts of the task, presenting a clear position with relevant ideas, though some may be underdeveloped or overly generalized.
Score 8-9: The response fully addresses all aspects of the task, presenting a well-developed position with relevant, extended, and well-supported ideas throughout.

dimensions.name: Coherence and Cohesion
dimensions.description: Coherence and cohesion refer to the clarity and logical flow of ideas in a text, as well as the effective use of linguistic devices to connect those ideas.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-1: The text fails to communicate any message or lacks any organizational features, making it incomprehensible.
Score 2-3: The organization of ideas is very limited, with little to no logical progression. Cohesive devices are rarely used and do not effectively connect ideas.
Score 4-5: Information is presented with some organization, but overall progression is lacking. Cohesive devices may be used inaccurately or repetitively, and paragraphing may be inadequate or confusing.
Score 6-7: Ideas are arranged coherently with a clear overall progression. A range of cohesive devices is used effectively, although there may be occasional faults. Paragraphing is present but may not always be logical.
Score 8-9: Information and ideas are sequenced logically with skillful management of cohesion. Paragraphing is appropriate and enhances the clarity of the text, attracting no attention to itself.

dimensions.name: Lexical Resource

dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: Extremely limited vocabulary; minimal control over word formation and spelling, severely hindering communication.
  
Score 3-4: Very basic vocabulary with frequent errors; limited ability to convey meaning, causing strain for the reader.
Score 5-6: Adequate vocabulary for the task; some attempts at using less common words, but with noticeable inaccuracies that do not significantly impede understanding.
Score 7-8: Sufficient range of vocabulary with some flexibility and precision; occasional inaccuracies in word choice or collocation, but generally effective communication.
Score 9-10: Wide range of sophisticated vocabulary used fluently and flexibly; rare minor errors occur, demonstrating a high level of lexical control and precision.

dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: 
  - Limited or no ability to use sentence forms; communication is severely hindered, often relying on memorized phrases or completely lacking structure.
Score 3-4: 
  - Attempts to use sentence forms but frequent grammatical and punctuation errors distort meaning; very limited range of structures with rare use of complex sentences.

dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-1: The response is completely unrelated to the task or does not attempt the task in any way, showing no understanding or engagement with the prompt.
Score 2-3: The response barely addresses the task, lacks a clear position, and presents few ideas that are largely undeveloped or irrelevant.
Score 4-5: The response partially addresses the task but may be tangential or unclear; it expresses a position that is not well supported, with limited main ideas that may include irrelevant details.
Score 6-7: The response addresses all parts of the task with a clear position, presenting relevant main ideas that are generally supported, though some ideas may be inadequately developed or overly generalized.
Score 8-9: The response fully addresses all parts of the task, presenting a well-developed position with relevant, extended, and well-supported ideas throughout.

dimensions.name: Coherence and Cohesion
dimensions.description: Coherence and cohesion refer to the clarity and logical flow of ideas in a text, ensuring that information is presented in an organized manner that is easy for the reader to follow.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-1: The text fails to communicate any message or has no discernible organization, making it incomprehensible to the reader.
Score 2-3: The text exhibits very little control over organizational features, with a lack of logical structure and minimal use of cohesive devices, resulting in confusion.
Score 4-5: The text presents information but lacks coherent arrangement and clear progression; cohesive devices may be used inaccurately or repetitively, and paragraphing may be inadequate.
Score 6-7: The text is arranged coherently with a clear overall progression; cohesive devices are used effectively, though there may be occasional faults in cohesion or referencing, and paragraphing is generally logical.
Score 8-9: The text is skillfully organized with logical sequencing of ideas; cohesion is managed seamlessly, and paragraphing is used appropriately to enhance clarity and flow.

dimensions.name: Lexical Resource
dimensions.description: Lexical Resource refers to the range and accuracy of vocabulary used in communication, assessing the ability to convey precise meanings and the control of lexical features.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: Extremely limited vocabulary with little to no control over word formation and spelling; communication is severely impaired or impossible.
Score 3-4: Very limited range of vocabulary with basic words; frequent errors in word formation and spelling may cause strain for the reader, making comprehension difficult.
Score 5-6: Adequate vocabulary for the task, with some attempts at using less common words; occasional inaccuracies and errors in spelling or word formation that do not significantly hinder communication.
Score 7-8: Sufficient to wide range of vocabulary used flexibly and with some sophistication; includes less common lexical items with occasional inaccuracies, but overall conveys precise meanings effectively.
Score 9-10: Extensive and sophisticated vocabulary with natural control; conveys nuanced meanings with rare minor errors, demonstrating a high level of lexical proficiency.

dimensions.name: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
dimensions.description: Grammatical Range and Accuracy refers to the variety and correctness of grammatical structures used in writing or speaking, assessing how well a person can communicate their ideas without errors.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: Limited Ability
- Characteristics: The individual struggles to use sentence forms, relying on memorized phrases or producing very few coherent sentences. Errors are frequent and severely hinder communication.
Score 3-4: Basic Control
- Characteristics: The individual attempts to use sentence forms but makes numerous grammatical and punctuation errors that distort meaning. There is a very limited range of structures, with rare use of complex sentences.
Score 5-6: Moderate Proficiency
- Characteristics: The individual uses a mix of simple and complex sentences, with some errors in grammar and punctuation. While errors may occur, they do not significantly impede understanding.
Score 7-8: Good Command
- Characteristics: The individual demonstrates a variety of complex structures and produces many error-free sentences. There may be occasional minor errors, but overall, grammar and punctuation are well controlled.
Score 9-10: Excellent Mastery
- Characteristics: The individual uses a wide range of grammatical structures with full flexibility and accuracy. Errors are rare and typically only minor slips, indicating a high level of proficiency in grammar.

dimensions.name: Task Response
dimensions.description: Task Response evaluates how well a response addresses the prompt, presents a clear position, and develops ideas with relevant support.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score 0-2: Minimal Response
   - Responses in this range barely address the task, lack a clear position, and present few or no developed ideas. They may be irrelevant or completely unrelated to the prompt.
Score 3-4: Limited Engagement
   - These responses show minimal engagement with the task, presenting unclear positions and poorly developed ideas. Main ideas may be difficult to identify and often lack relevance or support.
Score 5-6: Partial Coverage
   - Responses here partially address the task, expressing a position that may not be clearly articulated. Ideas are present but may be underdeveloped or repetitive, with some relevant points included.
Score 7-8: Clear and Relevant
   - This range indicates a clear position that addresses all parts of the task. Ideas are well-developed and supported, though there may be some generalizations or minor lapses in focus.
Score 9-10: Comprehensive and Insightful
   - Responses in this interval fully address all aspects of the task, presenting a well-developed and insightful position. Ideas are relevant, fully extended, and supported with strong evidence, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the prompt.

dimensions.name: Coherence and Cohesion
dimensions.description: Coherence and cohesion refer to the logical organization of ideas and the effective use of linguistic devices that connect sentences and paragraphs, ensuring clarity and flow in writing.
dimensions.scoring_criteria:
Score: 0-1
   - Fails to communicate any message or has very little control over organizational features, resulting in a lack of coherence and cohesion.
Score: 2-3
   - Displays minimal organization of ideas, with a very limited range of cohesive devices; relationships between ideas are unclear or illogical.
Score: 4-5
   - Presents information with some organization but lacks overall progression; may misuse cohesive devices and struggle with paragraphing, leading to confusion.
Score: 6-7
   - Arranges information coherently with a clear progression; uses cohesive devices effectively, though there may be occasional faults; paragraphs are generally clear but may lack logical structure at times.
Score: 8-10
   - Skillfully organizes information and ideas with logical sequencing; manages cohesion seamlessly, with effective paragraphing that enhances clarity and flow, attracting no attention to itself.

dimensions.description: Lexical Resource refers to the range and accuracy of vocabulary used in communication, assessing the ability to convey precise meanings and the control of lexical features.

Score 3-4: Very limited range of vocabulary; basic words are used repetitively or inappropriately, with frequent errors that strain comprehension.
Score 5-6: Adequate vocabulary for the task, with some attempts at using less common words; occasional errors in spelling and word formation that do not significantly hinder communication.
Score 7-8: Sufficient range of vocabulary that allows for flexibility and precision; skillful use of less common lexical items, though some inaccuracies may occur.
Score 9-10: Wide range of vocabulary used fluently and flexibly, demonstrating sophisticated control; rare minor errors may occur but do not detract from overall effectiveness.
